title: Meet Isai
text: Hi! My name is Isai (think Açaí → Içaí). I’m currently a student at the UNC School of Education working toward a PhD in Education Policy with a PhD minor in Computer Science. If I’m not working with data you can find me jogging, hiking a mountain trail, kayaking, digging for gold in Deep Rock Galactic or ensuring the factory grows in Factorio.

title: Research Interests
text:
I’m interested in the role of higher education for socioeconomic mobility of first generation students and students of color and the application of causal inference and machine learning methods to these questions.
Specifically I’m interested in:

Identifying causal mechanisms for the under-representation of women and students of color in the STEM pipeline.
Understanding role of unequal distribution of opportunity on college admission, persistence and completion.
Long term outcomes of students after they leave higher education as a function of major choice, college choice, and debt burden.
